title: Rishi Sunak, Now the Front-Runner for U.K. Prime Minister, Could Say, ‘I Told You So’
description: Mr. Sunak’s warnings about inflation and his fiscal conservatism may have cost him the post in September. But now his accurate assessments are easing his path to Britain’s top job.

title: Boris Johnson’s Statement on Withdrawing From Race
description: The former prime minister cited concerns about a divided party.

title: Boris Johnson’s Statement on Withdrawing From Race
description: The former prime minister cited concerns about a divided party.

title: As Russia and Ukraine Seek Gains on Front Line, U.S. and Allies Warn Moscow
description: Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III held a call with Russia’s defense chief to discuss President Vladimir Putin’s nuclear threats.

title: More Ukrainian Officials Accuse Russia of Slowing Grain Shipments
description: A U.N.-brokered deal ended a five-month Russian blockade of Ukrainian ports and freed millions of tons of agricultural products for a 120-day period.

title: Your Monday Briefing: Xi Jinping Consolidates Power
description: Plus Britain prepares for a new leader and Russia forcibly resettles Ukraine’s children.

title: Ngo Vinh Long, Lightning Rod for Opposing the Vietnam War, Dies at 78
description: After escaping arrest in Vietnam for his antiwar views, he became the most prominent Vietnamese in the United States to campaign against the war.

title: Russian Authorities Tell Civilians to ‘Immediately’ Leave Kherson
description: Kherson, which was captured by Russia early in the war, is a major industrial port city and the capital of the one of the four regions Russia has illegally annexed.

title: Xi Jinping Now Holds Near-Absolute Power in China, Creating Risks
description: Xi Jinping has created a new ruling elite packed with loyalist officials primed to elevate his agenda of bolstering national security and of turning China into a technological great power.

title: Russian Fighter Jet Crashes Into a Home in Serbia, Killing Two Pilots
description: The crash in Irkutsk was the second of a Russian warplane in a residential area within a week.

title: ‘We Heard It, We Saw It, Then We Opened Fire’
description: With an intense, hastily assembled effort, the Ukrainian military is pioneering successful techniques in the difficult art of anti-drone warfare.

title: For His 3rd Term, Xi Jinping Surrounds Himself With Loyalists
description: The men who were chosen have longstanding ties with Mr. Xi. For the first time in decades, no woman was chosen for the party’s Politburo, the policymaking body.

title: Race for U.K. Prime Minister Heats Up as Nominations Roll In
description: Conservative Party lawmakers have so far put more weight behind Rishi Sunak to be their next leader, but Boris Johnson is still in the fight to reclaim Downing Street.

title: Republicans’ Persistent 2020 Election Doubts
description: Hundreds of Republicans running for offices this year have questioned the 2020 election.

title: Hurricane Roslyn Strengthens to Category 4 and Heads Toward  Mexico
description: Roslyn became a Category 4 hurricane on Saturday. Forecasters warned it could bring coastal flooding and dangerous winds to cities along the Pacific Coast.

title: Russian Superyachts Find Safe Haven in Turkey, Raising Concerns in Washington
description: Turkey’s welcoming ports are symptoms of a much larger problem: evasion of U.S. sanctions against Russia.

title: China’s Politburo Has No Women, a Break With Custom
description: For the first time in decades, the Politburo has no female members. And no woman has ever been included in the even more exclusive and powerful Standing Committee.

title: Residents of Kherson Told to Evacuate as Battle Appears Imminent
description: Ukrainian troops have been advancing toward the Russian-held area, prompting pro-Moscow officials to ferry some people across a river by boat.

title: How China’s top leadership is selected.
A loyal aide in Shanghai takes a leading role in Beijing.
description: Li Qiang is now China’s second-highest official after Xi Jinping. Mr. Li’s time in Shanghai had raised questions about whether he would rise to the party’s highest levels.

title: How Political Primaries Drive Britain’s Dysfunction
description: In the United States, too, the rise of inside-party primaries has empowered candidates at the extremes, and the result is likely to be a greater disconnect with the public.

title: Xi is expected to unveil a new lineup of top officials.
Hu Jintao Was Escorted Out of China’s Congress, Raising Questions
description: A health scare? A brazen political gesture? Whatever else it was, the episode was awkward.
